OHBM 2018


This collection organizes a number of different talks from NISOx and NISOx collaborators at the 2018 Organization for Human Brain Mapping (OHBM) in Singapore, 17-21 June.

Talks

This section lists OHBM 2018 standalone talks by NISOx and NISOx collaborators.
  • Overview of Meta-Analysis Approaches
    Author: Thomas Nichols. doi:10.6084/m9.figshare.6723839.v1
  • Validity of summary statistics-based mixed-effects group fMRI
    Authors: Camille Maumet and Thomas Nichols. doi:10.6084/m9.figshare.6723851.v1
  • SwE-Toolbox: Fast and accurate modelling of longitudinal neuroimaging data
    Author: Thomas Nichols. doi:10.6084/m9.figshare.6723806.v1
  • 'Secrets of Success' or 'The yin and yang of career success'
    Author: Thomas Nichols. doi:10.6084/m9.figshare.6723836.v1
  • Same Data - Different Software - Different Results?
    Authors: Alexander Bowring, Camille Maumet, and Thomas Nichols. doi:10.6084/m9.figshare.6724616.v1
  • Practical intensity-based meta-analysis
    Authors: Camille Maumet and Thomas Nichols. doi:10.6084/m9.figshare.6724046.v1

Posters

This section lists posters submitted to OHBM 2018 by NISOx and NISOx collaborators. Boldface lettering indicates the day of presentation.
  • 1545-Tu/W/Th Genetics of the Young Adult Human Connectome Project Authors: Habib Ganjgahi, et al. doi:10.6084/m9.figshare.6724643.v1
  • 2001-Tu/W/Th A standardised representation for non-parametric fMRI results Authors: Camille Maumet, et al. doi:10.6084/m9.figshare.6724625.v1
  • 2019-Tu/W/Th Same Data - Different Software - Different Results? Authors: Alex Bowring, et al. doi:10.6084/m9.figshare.6724847.v1
  • 2521-Tu/W/Th Voodoo-corrected effect sizes without data splitting Authors: Sam Davenport and Thomas Nichols. doi:10.6084/m9.figshare.6724832.v1
  • 2636-Tu/W/Th Detecting and Interpreting Heterogeneity and Publication Bias in Image-Based Meta-Analyses Authors: Thomas Maullin-Sapey, et al. doi:10.6084/m9.figshare.6724631.v1
  • 2653-Tu/W/Th Choosing a practical and valid Image-Based Meta-Analysis Authors: Camille Maumet and Thomas Nichols. doi:10.6084/m9.figshare.6724628.v1
  • 2654-Tu/W/Th Validity of summary statistics-based mixed-effects group fMRI Authors: Camille Maumet and Thomas Nichols. doi:10.6084/m9.figshare.6724622.v1

Oxford Big Data Institute at the University of Oxford
